name: NPR
text:
Drugmaker AstraZeneca says it's pausing its COVID-19 vaccine trial because of a "potentially unexplained illness" in one of the trial volunteers. 

A safety review will be conducted to determine if it's a chance event or somehow related to the vaccine.
https://t.co/gt3NQMxnwm

name: NPR
text:
Peru's per capita death rate from COVID-19 is higher than almost any other nation. Now, its government has launched an emotional public-awareness campaign to fight the spread.

Its slogan: ‚ÄúCOVID does not kill by itself. Let‚Äôs not be accomplices.‚Äù
https://t.co/qPDGsI6Pu1

name: NPR
text:
An attorney hired by Trump appointee Michael Pack to investigate Voice of America's coverage for potential anti-Trump bias has an active court order against him ‚Äî stemming from a complaint that he made detailed death threats against his father.
https://t.co/7mTljlDB1t

name: NPR
text:
Japan's Olympic minister says the Tokyo Olympics should move forward in 2021 "at any cost."

Multiple officials in the past week have stressed that the games will proceed regardless of the state of the COVID-19 pandemic.
https://t.co/jt1MafdjW4

name: NPR
text:
Three firefighters have been hospitalized after battling the growing Dolan Fire in central California on Tuesday. One remains in critical condition, officials say.

https://t.co/G3siUpbl0i

name: NPR
text: RT @kcur: No Compromise from @NPR and @GunsReporting is here. @TwitrHagen and @ChrisHaxel report on a family that has used Facebook to spread their hard line vision of gun rights. Listen to the first episode wherever you download your podcasts. https://t.co/kjBBv7dWoi https://t.co/WkuhTdqzvr

name: NPR
text:
Philippines President Rodrigo Duterte granted an "absolute pardon" to a U.S. marine convicted of killing a trans woman in 2014.

He had initially been sentenced to a term of 6 to 12 years for homicide ‚Äî a sentence that was later reduced to 10 years.
https://t.co/WIpbCvFSQG

name: NPR
text:
Many Black Americans who spoke with NPR said that while they don't believe this current movement will change much today, they hope it'll help lead to change for generations to come.
https://t.co/ozPPR55gQN

name: NPR
text:
If math makes you a little nervous, you‚Äôre not the only one. You could even pass that anxiety along to your children. 

But there are strategies to make sure your kids grow up confident with numbers. Here are some tips to get started. (@nprlifekit)
https://t.co/BzTq7YFBsD

name: NPR
text:
Nearly half of America's child care centers could be permanently lost because of the pandemic, researchers warn.

Economists say that'll make it hard for parents to get back to work ‚Äî and is likely to disproportionately affect women.
https://t.co/l6McUW5gM0

name: NPR
text:
Experts say eating disorders have a strong link to trauma ‚Äî and they're thriving during the pandemic. That poses a lethal threat, as they have the second-highest mortality rate of any psychiatric diagnosis.
https://t.co/aKWJgDpEGl

name: NPR
text: School is back in session, but under circumstances that are vastly different for millions of children in the U.S. Today on #NPRConsider, we hear from teachers and coaches who are trying to navigate their way through a pandemic with their students. https://t.co/Fsfw5eQ8Sp

name: NPR
text: The DOJ moved to assume responsibility for defending President Trump in a defamation lawsuit brought by a woman who says Trump raped her in the 1990s. E. Jean Carroll filed suit last year after Trump denied knowing her and accused her of lying. https://t.co/5YAZCK7WJU

name: NPR
text:
Actress Jane Fonda has one word of advice for people looking for ways to get more involved with the climate movement: Vote. 

‚ÄúIt's safe to vote by mail, but do it early. Get your ballots early. Mail them early,‚Äù she says. (@wbur)  https://t.co/KnKqTt7q7O

name: NPR
text:
RT @NPRCodeSwitch: üßëüèø‚Äçü§ù‚ÄçüßëüèøNEW EP ALERT üë≠üèæ

Adults often find it really hard to talk about race. But kids? Maybe not so much. @npr_ed heard from thousands of students, and it was clear that race and identity were at the forefront of their minds.

https://t.co/PhC8kStue7

name: NPR
text:
Japan's reliance on fossil fuels has risen since the 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster ‚Äî except in Fukushima itself. The prefecture aims to be entirely fueled by renewable energy by 2040.

"We have to change," a local says. "This is for future generations." https://t.co/FdOCqEFgvV

name: NPR
text:
Federal officials are generally immune from defamation charges.

So, if successful, the Justice Department's filing asking a court to designate the U.S. ‚Äî rather than Trump ‚Äî as the defendant in a defamation suit would effectively bring the case to an end. https://t.co/8Q2uT1xFmr

name: NPR
text:
NPR found 93 cases in which police killed an unarmed person in the year after the Ferguson unrest.

29 ended in a settlement for the families of those killed.

The largest were in counties that voted for Hillary Clinton in the 2016 presidential election. https://t.co/VhH5Y88eFL

name: NPR
text: The 2020 fire season is off to a staggering start, far outpacing last year. Thousands of people on the West Coast are under evacuation orders, and more red flag warnings were issued today. https://t.co/xAWmLC0HkB https://t.co/MOJySRkdnq

name: NPR
text:
The U.S plans to reduce its troop levels in Iraq from 5,200 to 3,000, a senior U.S. military official says, attributing the cuts to confidence "in the Iraqi Security Forces' increased ability to operate independently." 
https://t.co/wLkjUNpIC1

name: NPR
text: President Trump told reporter Bob Woodward that he knew the coronavirus was ‚Äúmore deadly than even your strenuous flu" on Feb. 7 ‚Äî even as he was publicly downplaying its severity, according to Woodward's new book. https://t.co/Pl9aqsDs9n

name: NPR
text:
The next month, Trump admitted to playing down the virus's severity.

"I wanted to always play it down," Trump told Woodward on March 19. "I still like playing it down, because I don't want to create a panic." https://t.co/IR69ZvBLiq

name: NPR
text:
To compete for a Best Picture Oscar in 2024 and beyond, films must meet specific diversity standards in 2 out of 4 categories: 

üèÜ on-screen representation
üèÜ creative leadership + project team
üèÜ industry access + opportunities
üèÜ audience development https://t.co/Wootz1pI4h

name: NPR
text:
RT @nprpolitics: More than 6.3 million cases of the coronavirus have been identified in the U.S., and more than 189,000 people have died.

The latest data: https://t.co/rWxDaKrU2R

name: NPR
text: RT @nprmusic: On this week's Viking's Choice playlist from Lars Gotrich, hear South African spiritual-jazz ensemble SPAZA, Cincinnati indie-rockers The Ophelias and Philly oblong prog-rockers Godcaster. Plus, @totalvibration's queen Mariah Carey sings en espa√±ol! https://t.co/Xgh9CKDO9A https://t.co/bI03KLAqxU

name: NPR
text:
Indonesian officials put dummies wearing masks inside of coffins ‚Äî and displayed them around Jakarta. On Sept. 1, they actually started putting violators inside the coffins for 5 minutes "to reflect on their mistakes."

Both ideas quickly backfired.
https://t.co/77JkSELxZQ

name: NPR
text:
RT @lilkat_bigworld: In 2019, I read that a town next to Daiichi in Fukushima was reopening, after 8 years.

What does it mean to "open" a town like that, I wondered.

I pitched it at @npratc, asking if we had a reporter who could go. We didn't.

So a year later, photographer Claire Harbage & I went: https://t.co/ITCbKF5eEw

name: NPR
text:
President Trump released a list of another 20 potential Supreme Court picks ‚Äî including Sens. Ted Cruz and Tom Cotton.

He also named Daniel Cameron, who has faced widespread criticism for his handling of the Breonna Taylor case.
https://t.co/TAwZdQtobe

name: NPR
text:
RT @npratc: Young voters may be poised for a big turnout in 2020. Today on #NPRConsiderThis, how Gen Z ‚Äî those born in or after 1996 ‚Äî are thinking about presidential candidates and today's major political parties.
https://t.co/TPMH350rzX

name: NPR
text:
President Trump and Republicans pulled in a combined $210 million last month.

That could've set a one-month fundraising record ‚Äî if Joe Biden and Democrats hadn't raised about $150 million more than that.
https://t.co/Z4EccY3clf

name: NPR
text: At a campaign stop in Warren, Mich., Joe Biden‚Å† slammed President Trump for downplaying the deadliness of the coron‚Ä¶ https://t.co/JhNPbuYjYH

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden's recent lead in Minnesota polls has remained consistently in the single digits. State Democrats are sounding the alarm that rural voters could put Minnesota in play in 2020.
https://t.co/B0g7zauPmb
